snippet: Chrysler and Ford said their American sales rose last month to the highest level in at least four years, while General Motors said it sold a record number of fuel-efficient cars.
abstract: Automakers report strong sales across the board in March, pushing the industry to its best quarter since before the recession, despite rising gasoline prices; Chrysler and Ford say their American sales rose to the highest level in four years, confirming rosy outlook from analysts for the United States auto industry.
lead_paragraph: Chrysler and Ford said their American sales rose last month to the highest level in at least four years, while General Motors said it sold a record number of fuel-efficient cars.

headline.seo: U.S. Car Sales Climb, and Forecasts for 2012 Rise to 14 Million
headline.main: U.S. Car Sales Keep Up Their Firm Growth
headline.print_headline: Car Sales Rose in March, Lifting 2012 Forecasts
